title: 113_s2333
content: The Act titled "Caring for Military Children with Developmental Disabilities Act of 2014" focuses on behavioral health treatment of developmental disabilities under the TRICARE program. The Act "Caring for Military Children with Developmental Disabilities Act of 2014" amends Section 1077 of title 10, US Code to include behavioral health treatment, such as applied behavior analysis, for developmental disabilities like autism spectrum disorder when prescribed by a physician or psychologist. The Secretary must ensure treatment compliance in states with licensing or certification requirements. The Act "Caring for Military Children with Developmental Disabilities Act of 2014" amends Section 1077 of title 10, US Code to include behavioral health treatment, like applied behavior analysis, for developmental disabilities such as autism spectrum disorder. Treatment must be provided by a licensed or certified individual in accordance with state laws or by an individual licensed or certified by a state or accredited national certification board. Treatment can also be provided by employees, contractors, or trainees who meet minimum qualifications and training requirements set by applicable state laws or accredited national boards. The subsection allows for treatment of developmental disabilities under certain conditions and funding from the Defense Dependents Developmental Disabilities Account. The Defense Dependents Developmental Disabilities Account is established as a separate account for the Department of Defense, consisting of authorized appropriations or transfers. Amounts in the Account cannot be derived from transfers from the Department of Defense Medicare-Eligible. The Defense Dependents Developmental Disabilities Account is established for the Department of Defense, funded by various sources including the Department of Defense Medicare-Eligible Retiree Health Care Fund, Coast Guard Retired Pay Account, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Operations, Research, and Facilities Account, and Public Health Service Retirement Pay and Medical Benefits for Commissioned Officers Account. Amounts in the Account are available for treating developmental disabilities in covered beneficiaries until expended. For fiscal year 2015, $20,000,000 is authorized for the Defense Dependents Developmental Disabilities Account under the Department of Defense. Additionally, $250,000,000 will be transferred from the Defense Health Program for existing services.
